body: I think `DbSession` should check if [$newID](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/web/DbSession.php#L104) is properly set before trying to [update DB with it](https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/web/DbSession.php#L114).
looks like it. If session_regenerate_id fails to generate an ID, its no use to update the DB with it.

Should the old session row be deleted in case the new ID can not be generated? For something like to prevent loosing the old data in race condition case?

I've tested `DbSession` simulating loosing ID and deleting session row in that case - everything looks ok.

Same issue with Redis session implementation.
session_regenerate_id(): Session object destruction failed. ID: user (path: )
/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/web/Session.php L282
Yii2 2.0.10

issue.title: Fixed #13212 - DbSession failure when trying to regenerate session id

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #13212

body: @bizley I guess there is no need to delete session row. `session_regenerate_id` could fail, for instance, because of network issues and when will be ran second time it will return valid ID.
@yanhuixie it's a bit different, `DbSession::regenerateID` doesn't ask `session_regenerate_id` for session destruction
@andrewnester can you confirm that old row is deleted or updated later on? Because if not there is the risk of DB storage overfill.
@bizley thanks for reasonable question! In this case `DbSession:: gcSession` will handle all expired data

I still have issue with it. Here is what I have in log:

> Next yii\db\IntegrityException: SQLSTATE[23000]: Integrity constraint violation: 1062 Duplicate entry '1' for key 'PRIMARY'
The SQL being executed was: INSERT INTO `session` (`data`, `id`, `expire`) VALUES ('', 1, 1499947188) in /var/www/release/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/Schema.php:636

> Next yii\db\IntegrityException: SQLSTATE[23000]: Integrity constraint violation: 1062 Duplicate entry '5' for key 'PRIMARY'
The SQL being executed was: UPDATE `session` SET `id`=5 WHERE `id`='1v0dqepld1pk9eqn3rp0ckpsfc' in /var/www/release/vendor/yiisoft/yii2/db/Schema.php:636

One of the solution is to check if there is any duplicates in the database, before inserting or updating db. But I'm not sure this solution is the correct ones.

issue.title: Fix DbSession::writeSession race condition.

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no
| Tests pass?   | yes
| Fixed issues  | #13212

It has been previously reported #13212 There is a race condition in `DbSession::writeSession()`. 

```
Integrity constraint violation: SQLSTATE[23000]: Integrity constraint violation: 1062 Duplicate entry 'kupbup8mepuaco3dr5qdretsde' for key 'PRIMARY'
The SQL being executed was: INSERT INTO `YiiSession` (`data`, `id`, `expire`) VALUES ('__flash|a:0:{}', 'kupbup8mepuaco3dr5qdretsde', 1510386856)
```

After updating to `2.0.13`, I get around a dozen of those errors per day (I use MySQL 5.7), on a low traffic website that has less than a thousand visits a day. The session table has less than 1000 rows, the garbage collector is working correctly. I guess prior to `2.0.13` the errors were not exposed through the standard error logger - now this is fixed by #14908 

I'm not entirely sure why would the generated session id collide so often. My solution does the check if session id already exists in the storage in a transaction. Performance impact should be negligible as there should be only one session read/write per request.

body: I would like to reopen this issue as I now (after 2.0.13 upgrade) get a lot of errors like this. I've proposed a PR.
